meanings.definition: A loud, sharp, shrill cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The sudden shriek of the fire alarm startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: Her shriek of joy could be heard from across the playground.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's shriek of excitement when she saw the ice cream truck was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The shriek of the tea kettle on the stove signaled that it was time for a break.
meanings.sent5: The piercing shriek of the microphone feedback made everyone cover their ears.

meanings.definition: To utter a loud, sharp, shrill cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The toddler would shriek with delight every time he saw his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: She would shriek in fear whenever a spider appeared in the room.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to shriek the theme song of the TV show, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The wind would shriek through the trees on stormy nights, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The singer would shriek the high notes with such power that the audience was left in awe.
